issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares Farm.addAnimal(animal: Animal):boolean (i.e., returning a boolean), but the solution implements addAnimal(Animal) as void. The template does not provide an addAnimal stub with a return type either (the Main calls addAnimal(...) without checking a return). This mismatch between the UML and the implemented signature can confuse students about the expected method return type and cause tests/solutions to disagree (students might implement a boolean-returning method while the reference solution and tests expect void, or vice versa).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the method signature consistent across artifacts. Preferably update the UML in problem_statement.md to declare addAnimal(animal: Animal):void to match the textual description (which does not require a return value), the template usage in Main, and the solution. Alternatively, if a boolean return is desired, change the solution and template to implement addAnimal(Animal):boolean (e.g., return true on successful add) and update the problem text to specify the boolean return contract.
